acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (22:39): hi, question, in Chrome background-size works if I put it on 80%. In Firefox it doesn't. I've checked and now also have the -moz-background-size set but still nothing in Firefox...
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (22:39): what am I doing wrong?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:51): Does the version of FF you're testing against support background-size?
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:55): https://developer.mozilla.org/en/css/-moz-background-size
cc7bcfbc58c467939c5987584fc882cb (22:55): 3.6 requires a prefix, 4.0 doesnt anymore
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:01): using 4.0
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:01): http://twixted.hatkeintuv.de:8888/all4wheels/ that's the site in question
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:02): if you inspect the element #main-menu li a
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:02): it does show the css it should use but somehow it doesn't do anything with it
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:06): Try changing the 'background' declaration on line 7 to just background-image.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:06): That *shouldn't* affect anything, but FF may be buggy and reseting the -size property when you use the background shorthand.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:07): it now dissapeared completely
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:07): even went *poof* in chrome
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:07): lemme check
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:07): Oh, right.  The no-repeat value there would then need to be pulled out into background-repeat.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:08): whoo
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:08): works
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:08): If that worked, then FF is buggy.  File a bug, please?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:08): firefox actually does the center center more nicely then chrome
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:08): uhm, where?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:09): bugzilla.mozilla.org
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:09): cool I will
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:11): funny since I fixed it in Firefox now Chrome suddenly also does it properly centered

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:12): Same deal - background-size was being reset by the 'background' rule, because 'background' was more specific than all the background-* rules you had set generally on the links.

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:13): Why are you doing this with backgrounds, though?  Why not just use an <img> with @alt, rather than putting in real text, hiding it, then putting in an image via the background property?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:24): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: because drupal #^@#%& sucks
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:25): already had to make a custom function to get an extra span
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:25): Ah, indeed it does.  I recommend not using it.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:25): well considering the budget for this website
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:25): it's probably the cheapest solution
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:25): joomla really sucks
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:25): wordpress is for blogs
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:26): I've been reasonably happy with Django, if you really need a CMS.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:30): I unfortuanly spend waaay too much time already on Drupal atm to switch
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:35): still didn't get my bugzilla email :p
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:35): ah spam folder lol
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:38): suspects he could construct a minimal test-case for the really annoying Web Inspector bug in Chrome, with some effort
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:38): Unfortunately, I lack the time to expend effort.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:39): I think that when scripts are reloaded and change, it still partially caches the old version of the script sometimes, which means it only lets you set breakpoints at lines that you could have set breakpoints at in the previous version of the file.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:39): Your margins is too narrow?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (23:43): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=641977
20fcf9036c0e310be5e5370c43479b92 (00:00): dreaming of the day we can have some consistency in keyboard shortcuts for web apps :|
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:01): chrome seems really good at it, not eating many alt- keys; but everyone else...
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (00:02): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: happy to have been able to file a bug!
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:03): Thanks for doing so!
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:04): can't even use , and . as hotkeys--Opera users get irate
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:05): We need a new hyper key which is explicitly reserved for use by apps.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:06): every time a new encapsulation layer is added to computers, a new key is needed
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:06): windows key, control key, web key
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:15): Just do what I do and say that you get the web key when you press Alt+Ctrl+Windows at the same time.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:15): (I use this combo to move between desktops.)
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:17): i'll avoid using key combinations that many keyboards physically can't register. heh
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:22): heh, i'm half-inclined to just stomp over browser hotkeys (since they'll let you, generally) for web apps, so long as they don't give a better option :|
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (00:35): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: we just need to get everyone to use the space cadet keyboard; then we'll have several modifiers for use by web apps
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:40): browsers just need to let go of alt/meta :|
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (00:41): was easier for chrome to do (from the beginning) than for old browsers (with users and user habits), but I think it's just something to get over

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:52): acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c: Sorry for misinforming you - I somehow missed the 'background-size' in the list of properties that the 'background' shorthand reset.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:52): So Firefox's behavior is correct, Chrome's isnt.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (00:54): huh, but isn't the idea of CSS that it overrides based on cascading?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (00:55): so my latter definition of the size should still affect it
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (00:55): and not ignore?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (00:57): acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c: the selector setting the plain 'background' property has higher specificity.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:06): then it still doesn't get overidden?

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:07): No, because the 'background' shorthand acts like all the component properties were being set instead.  Thus, the "background-size:initial" that is implied by your rule overrides the "background-size:80%" that you actually have.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:07): Same with the background-position.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:13): but then how can I override the 80% to the 100% later?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:13): cause that works...
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:18): I don't understand the question.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:24): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: well, if I define a background: the initial gets set and can't be overriden you say
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:24): but then why can a background-size be overridden when it has been set?
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:24): or is initial some special thing that can't change anymore?

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:28): No, it gets overridden because the 'background' property has higher specificity than your 'background-size' declaration.  It's not permanent or unfixable.  You can either set the individual property with a higher-specificity selector, or switch away from using the shorthand, since it's unnecessary in your case.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:29): (Just move 'background-repeat:no-repeat' to the general rules for "#main-menu > li > a", and then use background-image in the specialized rules.
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:29): yep that's what I did

acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:30): just that background: ended up there because of laziness and simply because it *worked* in chrome but didn't in firefox and saw no real reason why it shouldn't have worked :)
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:30): goes very deeply by the if it works don't fix it concept
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:30): Except it didn't work in Chrome - the background property was resetting your background-position rule. ^_^
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:30): anyway :) ttyl, gotta get up early to bring my gf to the foot-specialist to figure out what she exactly broke
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:31): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: true :)
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:31): cool thanks for the help
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:31): hehe
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:31): saved this channel in autojoin
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:32): have to join it each time but forget
acae41ccab36a545a6c58b2f50fe025c (01:32): hehe
